intro: Erlangea schimperi, commonly known as the Ethiopian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
